name: Lost Draft
founderReview: Okay coffee at a high price tag, phenomenal space for working in the heart of SoHo

name: Georgie's
founderReview: Industrial with tall tall windows, green and lush interior, great baked goods and coffee (way too crowded these days)

name: Gotan
founderReview: Tons of natural lighting with woody interior. Perfect for a day in Tribeca with maybe the best eggs in NY.

name: McNally Jackson Cafe
founderReview: Nostalgic. McNally's best location nestled in Seaport. Great for a grab and go cup to explore the area.

name: The Mandarin
founderReview: If Chic had a physical representation in the city this cafe is it. Third wave coffee in a third space, perfect waiting area if you put your name down at golden diner right next door.

name: Gather
founderReview: Huge space for working in the heart of the LES with amazing food options (cafes like these with food are a dime a dozen in the city)

name: Manjul
founderReview: Beautiful interior with purist espresso and pour-overs. No different than the usual city prices but the coffee could be a bit better. Hottest cafe in soho!

name: Stone St
founderReview: The place to go if Lost Draft is full (or vice versa). The best for working and eating with an amazing outdoor seating area if that's your jam.

name: Daily Provisions - West Village
founderReview: My favorite cafe in the city in the world. Great location for a day in west village and the best in-cafe food you can get. The best remote working cafe!

name: Merriweather coffee + kitchen
founderReview: Underrated bustling cafe in the west village. Great food great ambience and solid place to get some work done. (place to be if you want to network with HNW folks on their break)

name: Le Gaz
founderReview: Decent coffee but indie setting, right at the end of NYC's best shopping street

name: Davelle
founderReview: BEST matcha in the city. amazing food as well with option to take out. not a WFH cafe.

name: Kaida Coffee and Bakery
founderReview: Cute cafe that's never crowded. The spot for a quick work session if you're local to the area.

name: Cha&
founderReview: Very good baristas (they gave me a free sample). Tea selection is great.

name: Le Phin
founderReview: Used to be go to spot for NYU folk! Cute small little place, nice for reading but hard to work in. Fun drinks!

name: Abraco
founderReview: Amazing coffee. Lots of space to sit and chill after a EV day but hard to work in.

name: La Cabra East Village
founderReview: My favorite pastries in the city (people tend to forget). Amazing coffee. Con: always super crowded

name: Park at KIMS
founderReview: My new favorite speciality coffee house. Very affordable pourovers and aesthetic interior. Great stop for a day in soho.

name: Lion's Milk
founderReview: Best cafe in WB to work in. Good pastries that are more filling than usual - perfect to spend all day in.
